data.title: Way Cool
data.text: This place makes a great latte that you can hang out in their side lounges and enjoy. Quiet. Relaxing. A cool place to spend some time de-stressing.

data.title: Love it
data.text: I love this place. A great place to get work done (they have ample electrical outlets) and sip on decent coffee. I only wish they had more drink items on their menu! I'd love to see some smoothies or lemonades! I've never had a bad encounter with staff, and I never will. Overall, Mugs rocks. It's such a wonderful break from the monotony of chain-coffee establishments.

data.title: Convenient but Ok
data.text: This coffee shop is absolutely adorable inside and has such a homey feel! The staff isn't always the friendliest, also their hours are kind of weird. Prices are about the same as Starbucks.

data.title: Not a friendly place
data.text: Walked in on a Monday morning about 9:00AM.  I said hello with a smile on my face and the person behind the counter barely acknowledged me.  I was the only customer at the counter.  It took her a minute or two to finish what she was doing (looked like she was tidying up) to finally ask me what I want.  I ordered and then mentioned that I was across the street on Sunday morning and saw so many people trying to go to this place but it was closed and asked why they don't open on Sunday.  The woman behind the counter kind of snapped at me "Because we don't" and really seemed like I was bothering her rather then trying to be a customer.   At that time, the person I assume was the owner comes into the room and is on a tirade about how angry she was because some customer spilled coffee without telling anyone and people were tracking it on her floor.  She was really angry and loud.  I would never ever go there again.  Dirty, unprofessional and rude.

data.title: Meh...
data.text: Nice to have a local coffee shop but there were more downsides than good on two recent visits. Pros: Cute shop and really good baked goods. Cons: Pricey everything, some staff not friendly and coffee not good. I've tried several different kinds (including lattes, espresso, etc.) and it never tastes good. I think it may be the brand they use. Not sure if this has changed since I've been in... but would love for them to sell used books too (instead of all new) and help their local/crunchy vibe. Bottom line: I need good coffee and fun/nice staff. Love the atmosphere so if those could be worked on, I could def become a regular. *Side note, the creamer had turned bad, and when I brought it (my coffee with curdled creamer) back to the front, they apologized, switched the creamer out without offering to give me a new coffee. When I asked, they politely exchanged but should I have to ask?* Ew.

data.title: Great Coffee Shop
data.text: It's a nice little coffee shop located in downtown Alpharetta.  The drinks are good and prices are on par with Starbucks.

data.title: Alpharetta coffee house
data.text: For those looking for a non Starbucks coffee shop, this is it. Excellent espresso. Good lunches, though somewhat pricey for what you get. Very relaxed. Stay as long as you like.

data.title: The Coffee Shop You Read About in Books
data.text: This place is the coffee shop you read about in fiction books or see on your favorite TV show. It's got its own character and cozy corners to read a book or meet with a friend. It is perfect for meetings and chilling with your pet on the patio. The drinks are good and the coffee is tasty. The pastries, especially all of the biscuit varieties are flavorful. Try it! It is right on the Alpharetta main street and great for after a much or dinner at the many restaurants that surround it.
